intro: Cyrtandra aequalis, commonly known as the equal beauty or Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, particularly Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with opposite, ovate leaves that have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane rainforests. Cyrtandra aequalis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
